result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharon M Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Roseline M. unless initiated by victim/her.

$200.00 bail applied. Balance of $3.00 due to Probation. To be paid as a condition.
DNA waives surcharge based on violation.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.
